content:
Phishing Risk Analysis

Our analysis of the URL "http://secure-paypal.com.verification.dunsguide.org" has revealed a very high phishing risk score of 97. This strongly suggests that the website is likely a fraudulent attempt to steal your personal information. We urge you to exercise extreme caution and avoid interacting with this site.

Key Risk Indicators

  • Suspicious Domain Name: The URL uses "dunsguide.org" as the top-level domain, while attempting to mimic PayPal with "secure-paypal.com.verification" as a subdomain. Legitimate PayPal sites use "paypal.com." This technique is often used by phishers to trick users into thinking they are on a trusted website.
  • Unsecure Protocol (HTTP): The URL uses "http" instead of "https." Secure websites, especially those handling financial transactions, should always use HTTPS, which encrypts communication between your browser and the website. The absence of HTTPS is a major red flag.
  • Lengthy and Complex URL: Phishers often create long, complex URLs to obfuscate the actual website address and make it harder to recognize as fraudulent. Legitimate websites, particularly those related to financial services, tend to have shorter, clearer URLs.

Technical Assessment

The URL structure itself reveals several suspicious elements. The presence of "secure-paypal.com" within the subdomain is a clear attempt to impersonate PayPal. However, the actual domain is "dunsguide.org," which has no legitimate connection to PayPal. The use of multiple subdomains like "verification" further adds to the complexity and suspicious nature of the URL. Additionally, the lack of an SSL certificate (indicated by the "http" protocol) means any information you submit to this website would be transmitted in plain text, making it easily interceptable by malicious actors.

What This Means For You

If you interact with this phishing site, you risk compromising sensitive information such as your PayPal login credentials, credit card details, bank account information, and other personal data. This could lead to financial loss, identity theft, and other serious consequences.

Recommended Actions

  • Do not click on the link: Avoid accessing this URL under any circumstances.
  • Report the phishing attempt: Report the suspicious URL to PhishGuard and to PayPal directly. This helps protect others from falling victim to the same scam.
  • Check your PayPal account: If you have already clicked the link and entered any information, immediately change your PayPal password and review your recent account activity for any unauthorized transactions.
  • Run a security scan: Consider running a full security scan on your device to ensure no malware has been installed.
